result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lashan M. Dixon

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Becky.
Case called: 9:40 am
INCLUDES 15CM887, 15CM2399, 15CM2385 & 16CM202
Date and Time set for Sentencing After Revocation in 15CM887 & Plea Hearing in 15CM2399, 15CM2385 & 16CM202
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner; Def appears in custody with Atty Pauline Toulouse;  

***PLEA HEARING in 15CM2399, 15CM2385 & 16CM202***
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed; VRCW;
State moves to: D&RI 15CM2385 & 16CM202
COURT GRANTS

PLEA: 
15CM2399
Ct 1 (Criminal Damage to Property/DA/Repeater)>NO CONTEST
Ct 2 (DC/DA/Repeater)>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SHW for 2 years probation. CONDITIONS: SAFE Intake program and any recommended follow up; Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not fully engaged, complete 10 hours CS per week; A/T/C as deemed appropriate by agent; No contact with T.E. unless approved by agent; CC; 2-DA surcharges; DNA sample and surcharge.

***SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION IN 15CM887***
COURT ORDERS: Ct 1> 90 days MCJ w/huber for work/school/child care & counseling if deft meets jail criteria.
COURT notes deft has 41 days credit.

Adj: 9:50 am

Case called:  2:06 pm  
Clerk: Kim 
15CM886 and 15CM887
State appears in person by ADA Michael Puerner;  Defendant appears in person and with Atty Kat Jackan by Amanda Ley.  Date and time set for plea hearing.  VRCW. Victim Impact Statement filed.  Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. State moves to DRI 15CM886.  COURT grants.  
PLEA: Guilty
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  
State addresses Court.  Atty Ley addresses Court and requests 60 days credit if revoked.  
COURT ORDERS: SWH 1 year probation (concurrent).  Conditions:  Complete Safe Program Intake and follow through w/agent, complete AODA and counseling as deemed by agent, absolute sobriety, court costs includes DNA surcharge and FTE/FTS and/or child care (combination), if not, 10 hours CS per wk.  If revoked, free to argue days of credit.
Adjourned:  2:20 pm

Pre-trial conference on June 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Final pre-trial on August 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury Trial on September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

INCLUDES 15CM886 & 15CM887 Shall not consume alcohol. No bars, taverns, liquor stores, or beer tents. Absolute sobriety.WPD Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings.  No contact with victim(s):K.L. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.

ADDRESS INFO for Lashan M. Dixon
Current: 1225 S 11th Ave, Wausau, WI 54401 United States  (Effective: 05-11-2015)
Prior: 401 S. 5th Avenue, Wausau, WI 54401
